intro: Sorindeia multifoliolata var. watsaensis, commonly known as the Watsaensis sorindeia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, palmately compound leaves that are often lobed and have a velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in shaded, humid environments, often found in tropical or subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
